description: Migration of dimensional structure and fundamental constants to ParameterMetadata template

parameters.title: Bulk Spacetime Dimension
parameters.long_description: The bosonic string requires 26 dimensions for Virasoro anomaly cancellation. D = 26 is the only critical dimension for bosonic strings, uniquely fixed by the condition that the total central charge must vanish: c_total = c_matter + c_ghost = D + (-26) = 0.
parameters.derivation: Virasoro algebra has central extension with total central charge c_total. Matter fields contribute c_matter = D (one per coordinate). Faddeev-Popov ghosts (bc system, weights 2,-1) contribute c_ghost = -26. BRST cohomology requires c_total = 0 for consistent quantization. Therefore D = 26 is the unique critical dimension.
references: Bars, I. (2006) 'Survey of two-time physics', Class. Quantum Grav. 18, 3113
parameters.notes: Unlike 10D/11D string theories which require supersymmetry, D=26 is the unique critical dimension for bosonic strings from first principles.
parameters.website_only_notes: See Appendix A for (24,2) signature validation and simulation code

parameters.title: Initial Bulk Signature
parameters.description: Two timelike dimensions in 26D bulk spacetime
parameters.long_description: We adopt signature (24,2) following Bars' two-time physics program, which provides a covariant framework for eliminating unphysical degrees of freedom through gauge symmetry rather than constraint equations. The (24,2) signature enables covariant treatment of gauge constraints via Sp(2,R), rather than non-covariant light-cone quantization.
parameters.derivation: Two-time physics requires gauge symmetry to remove ghost states. Sp(2,R) is minimal gauge group preserving symplectic structure. The Sp(2,R) gauge symmetry projects out negative-norm states and the unphysical time, reducing 26D → 13D without breaking Lorentz invariance.
parameters.notes: Following Bars' program, the (24,2) signature enables covariant treatment of gauge constraints via Sp(2,R), rather than non-covariant light-cone quantization.
parameters.website_only_notes: The Sp(2,R) gauge constraints eliminate exactly 13 degrees of freedom through gauge fixing, reducing the 26-dimensional phase space to a physical 13-dimensional configuration space.

parameters.title: Shadow Dimension after Sp(2,R)
parameters.description: Effective after t_⊥ compactification via Sp(2,R) gauge fixing
parameters.long_description: After Sp(2,R) gauge fixing, the effective dimension reduces from 26D to 13D. The Sp(2,R) gauge symmetry projects out negative-norm states and the unphysical time, reducing 26D → 13D without breaking Lorentz invariance. Three first-class constraints eliminate exactly 13 degrees of freedom through gauge fixing.
parameters.derivation: Sp(2,R) constraints: X² = 0, P² = 0, X·P = 0 (three first-class constraints). These constraints eliminate exactly 13 degrees of freedom through gauge fixing, reducing the 26-dimensional phase space to a physical 13-dimensional configuration space. The reduction is D_shadow = D_bulk / 2 = 26 / 2 = 13.
parameters.notes: This is NOT a compactification but a gauge fixing/projection. The Sp(2,R) constraints are first-class in the Dirac sense, forming a closed constraint algebra under Poisson brackets.
parameters.website_only_notes: The stabilizer group is SO(12,1) ⊂ SO(24,2) with dimension 78. Coset dimension = dim G - dim H = 325 - 78 = 247.

parameters.title: Bulk Signature after Sp(2,R)
parameters.description: One time remains observable after Sp(2,R) gauge fixing
parameters.long_description: After Sp(2,R) gauge fixing, one time remains observable. The signature reduces from (24,2) to (12,1). The Sp(2,R) gauge constraints eliminate the unphysical time dimension, leaving a single observable time coordinate.
parameters.derivation: The Sp(2,R) gauge symmetry projects out negative-norm states and the unphysical time, reducing the signature from (24,2) to (12,1) without breaking Lorentz invariance.
parameters.notes: The second timelike dimension is not compactified but gauge-fixed away by Sp(2,R) constraints.

parameters.title: Internal Manifold Dimension
parameters.long_description: The internal compactification manifold is a 7-dimensional G₂ holonomy manifold (or equivalently CY3×S¹/Z₂). The G₂ holonomy preserves exactly one spinor, generating N=1 SUSY in 4D without fundamental superpartners.
parameters.derivation: G₂ ⊂ Spin(7) preserves exactly one spinor (N=1 in 4D). This is the geometric realization of supersymmetry emergence from compactification.
references: Joyce, D. (2000) Compact Manifolds with Special Holonomy
Acharya, B.S. (2008). Proton Decay in M-theory on G₂ Manifolds
parameters.notes: G₂ holonomy generates N=1 SUSY in 4D without fundamental superpartners. This is emergent SUSY, not postulated.
parameters.website_only_notes: The specific G₂ manifold is TCS (Twisted Connected Sum) construction #187 from Corti et al. (2015).

parameters.title: Effective Spacetime after G₂ Compactification
parameters.long_description: After G₂ compactification, the effective spacetime dimension is 6D. This is the bulk spacetime before final compactification to 4D. The calculation is: D_eff = D_after_sp2r - D_internal = 13 - 7 = 6.
parameters.derivation: G₂ compactification reduces 13D → 6D. The calculation is: D_eff = D_after_sp2r - D_internal = 13 - 7 = 6. This is the effective bulk spacetime after compactification of the 7D internal manifold.
parameters.notes: This is the effective bulk before final compactification to observable 4D. The signature is (5,1).
parameters.website_only_notes: The 6D effective bulk hosts the brane hierarchy structure: 1 observable (6D) + 3 shadow (4D) branes.

parameters.title: Effective Signature after G₂
parameters.description: Five spatial + one time in 6D effective bulk
parameters.long_description: After G₂ compactification, the effective signature is (5,1): five spatial dimensions plus one time dimension. This is the signature of the 6D effective bulk spacetime.
parameters.derivation: After G₂ compactification of 7D internal manifold from 13D (12,1), the effective signature is (5,1). All compactified dimensions are spatial.
parameters.notes: The effective bulk has 5 spatial + 1 time dimension before final compactification to observable 4D.

parameters.title: Common Dimensions
parameters.description: Accessible to all branes (3 space + 1 time)
parameters.long_description: The common dimensions accessible to all branes (1 observable + 3 shadow). This is the standard 3+1 dimensional spacetime experienced by all branes in the hierarchy.
parameters.derivation: Observable 4D spacetime emerges from the shared sector accessible to all branes. This is the low-energy effective 3+1 dimensional spacetime.
parameters.notes: This is the standard 3+1 dimensional spacetime observed at low energies. All branes (observable + shadow) share access to these dimensions.
parameters.website_only_notes: Shadow branes are restricted to D_common = 4D only, while the observable brane has access to 2 additional shared dimensions (D_observable = 6D).

parameters.title: Shared Extra Dimensions
parameters.description: Extra dimensions accessible to observable brane only
parameters.long_description: The observable brane has access to 2 additional shared extra dimensions beyond the 4D common spacetime. These extra dimensions are NOT accessible to shadow branes. Total observable brane dimension: D_observable = D_common + D_shared = 4 + 2 = 6D.
parameters.derivation: The observable brane dimension is 6D (5,1). After accounting for 4D common spacetime, this leaves 2 extra dimensions: D_shared = D_observable - D_common = 6 - 4 = 2.
parameters.notes: These 2 extra dimensions are accessible to the observable brane only, NOT to shadow branes. This is the 'shared extra dimensions' solution to the hierarchy problem.
parameters.website_only_notes: The shared extra dimensions host KK gravitons with mass ~5 TeV, potentially observable at future colliders.

parameters.title: Total Brane Count
parameters.long_description: The brane hierarchy consists of 4 total branes: 1 observable brane (6D) and 3 shadow branes (4D each). This heterogeneous brane structure is derived from the dimensional reduction cascade.
parameters.derivation: The brane hierarchy emerges from the dimensional reduction cascade: 26D → 13D → 6D → 4D. The 6D bulk hosts 1 observable brane + 3 shadow branes.
parameters.notes: The 3 shadow branes correspond to ancient traditions: Kuf (Air/East), Chet (Fire/South), Shin (Water/West). See BraneNomenclature class in config.py.
parameters.website_only_notes: The observable brane is 6D (5,1), shadow branes are 4D (3,1). Shadow branes are restricted to D_common only.

parameters.title: Observable Brane Dimension
parameters.long_description: The observable brane has dimension 6D with signature (5,1). This decomposes as: 4D_common (accessible to all branes) + 2D_shared (observable brane only). At low energies, the 2 extra dimensions are compactified on a 2D torus, yielding effective 4D spacetime.
parameters.derivation: Observable brane dimension: D_observable = D_common + D_shared = 4 + 2 = 6D with signature (5,1). The 2 extra dimensions are compactified at scale R_c ~ (5 TeV)^{-1}.
parameters.notes: The observable brane is our universe. The 2 extra dimensions are compactified on a 2D torus at scale ~(5 TeV)^{-1}, yielding KK gravitons potentially observable at future colliders.
parameters.website_only_notes: The 6D → 4D compactification gives KK graviton mass M_KK = 1/R_c ~ 5.0 TeV (see kk_graviton_mass_v12_fixed.py).

parameters.title: Shadow Brane Dimension
parameters.long_description: Shadow branes have dimension 4D with signature (3,1). They are restricted to the common dimensions D_common only, with NO access to the 2 shared extra dimensions. There are N_shadow = 3 shadow branes in total.
parameters.derivation: Shadow branes are restricted to common dimensions only: D_shadow = D_common = 4D with signature (3,1). They have no access to the 2 shared extra dimensions.
parameters.notes: Shadow branes are NOT observable directly but interact gravitationally via bulk. They provide dark matter candidates and contribute to thermal friction on Pneuma condensate.
parameters.website_only_notes: The 3 shadow branes are: Kuf (Air/East), Chet (Fire/South), Shin (Water/West). See BraneNomenclature.NAMES.

parameters.title: Shadow Brane Count
parameters.description: Number of shadow branes in the hierarchy
parameters.long_description: There are 3 shadow branes in the brane hierarchy, in addition to the 1 observable brane. Total: N_branes = 1 + N_shadow = 4. The shadow branes are named: Kuf (Air/East), Chet (Fire/South), Shin (Water/West).
parameters.derivation: The brane hierarchy structure is: 1 observable + 3 shadow branes. This emerges from the dimensional reduction cascade and brane positioning in the extra dimensions.
parameters.notes: The 3 shadow branes correspond to ancient elemental traditions. See BraneNomenclature class for full mapping to elements, directions, and physics roles.
parameters.website_only_notes: Shadow branes contribute thermal friction coefficient gamma = 0.5 to Pneuma dynamics (see thermal_friction_v12_8.py).

parameters.title: Pneuma Spinor Dimension (Full 26D)
parameters.long_description: The Pneuma is an 8,192-component spinor in 26D from Clifford algebra Cl(24,2). The spinor dimension follows from the standard formula for spinor representations in even dimensions: dim = 2^(D/2) = 2^(26/2) = 2^13 = 8192.
parameters.derivation: 26D Clifford algebra: {Γ^M, Γ^N} = 2η^{MN} with M,N = 0,...,25. Spinor dimension in even dimensions: dim = 2^(D/2) = 2^(26/2) = 2^13 = 8192 components.
parameters.notes: The Pneuma condensate generates geometry, time arrow, and all Standard Model matter. This is NOT a fundamental field but an emergent degree of freedom.
parameters.website_only_notes: After Sp(2,R) reduction: 8192 → 64 effective components in 13D shadow. After G₂ chirality: projects to chiral 4D Weyl spinors (4 components).

parameters.title: Pneuma Dimension (Reduced 13D)
parameters.description: After Sp(2,R) gauging and Z₂ mirroring
parameters.long_description: After Sp(2,R) gauge fixing and Z₂ mirroring, the Pneuma spinor reduces from 8192 components to 64 effective components in 13D shadow spacetime. The reduction formula is: dim_reduced = dim_full / (2^(gauging_dofs/2)) / mirroring_factor = 8192 / (2^(12/2)) / 2 = 8192 / 64 / 2 = 64.
parameters.derivation: Sp(2,R) reduction: 8192 → 64 effective components. Calculation: dim_reduced = 8192 / (2^(12/2)) / 2 = 8192 / 64 / 2 = 64. The gauging_dofs = 12 from Sp(2,R) gauge degrees of freedom, mirroring_factor = 2 from Z₂ mirror symmetry.
parameters.notes: The 64-component spinor in 13D is then further reduced by G₂ holonomy to chiral 4D Weyl spinors (4 components).

todos.issue: String value 'G2' doesn't fit numeric ParameterMetadata template. Consider adding to separate 'string parameters' section or create companion metadata structure.
Legacy parameter marked for phase-out. Include in migration but flag as deprecated with note to use d-common instead.
Legacy parameter (=3). Flag as deprecated, use d-common decomposition instead.
Legacy parameter (=1). Flag as deprecated, inherent in signature notation.

notes: All 15 dimensional/fundamental parameters have complete ParameterMetadata entries
OOM calculated as log10(abs(value)) where applicable (not for signatures)
Paper Section 2 text quoted directly per instructions
All used_in_formulas traced from config.py FORMULAS registry
